title: Prohibits the performance of illegal maneuvers while operating a motorcycle; penalties and fines
summary: Prohibits the performance of illegal maneuvers while operating a motorcycle; penalties, fines and revocation of license and registration.

       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3227

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. COLTON, BENEDETTO -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of
         A. BURLING, CERETTO, MONTESANO, ROBINSON -- read once and referred  to
         the Committee on Transportation

       AN  ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to performance
         of illegal maneuvers while operating a motorcycle

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  vehicle  and  traffic law is amended by adding a new
    2  section 1254 to read as follows:
    3    S 1254. PERFORMANCE OF AN ILLEGAL MANEUVER WHILE OPERATING A  MOTORCY-
    4  CLE.  (A)  "ILLEGAL  MANEUVER"  SHALL MEAN ANY MANEUVER PERFORMED BY THE
    5  OPERATOR OF A MOTORCYCLE WHICH REQUIRES THE FRONT OR REAR WHEEL OF  SUCH
    6  MOTORCYCLE  TO LEAVE CONTACT WITH THE ROAD, OR ANY MANEUVER DESCRIBED IN
    7  SUBDIVISIONS (B) AND (C) OF SECTION TWELVE  HUNDRED  FIFTY-TWO  OF  THIS
    8  ARTICLE.
    9    (B) THE OPERATOR OF A MOTORCYCLE SHALL NOT PERFORM AN ILLEGAL MANEUVER
   10  WHILE OPERATING A MOTORCYCLE.
   11    (C) A VIOLATION OF SUBDIVISION (B) OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE PUNISHABLE
   12  BY  A  FINE  OF  TWO  HUNDRED  FIFTY  DOLLARS AND SHALL NOT EXCEED THREE
   13  HUNDRED EIGHTY-FIVE DOLLARS.
   14    (D) A SECOND VIOLATION OF SUBDIVISION  (B)  OF  THIS  SECTION,  WITHIN
   15  EIGHTEEN  MONTHS  OF  PRIOR CONVICTION, SHALL BE PUNISHABLE BY A FINE OF
   16  THREE HUNDRED EIGHTY-FIVE DOLLARS AND SHALL NOT EXCEED SIX  HUNDRED  TEN
   17  DOLLARS.   IN ADDITION TO ANY PENALTIES WHICH MAY BE IMPOSED PURSUANT TO
   18  THIS SUBDIVISION, THE  VIOLATOR'S  LICENSE  AND  REGISTRATION  SHALL  BE
   19  REVOKED AUTOMATICALLY FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR.
   20    (E)  A  THIRD  OR  SUBSEQUENT  VIOLATION  OF  SUBDIVISION  (B) OF THIS
   21  SECTION, WITHIN EIGHTEEN MONTHS OF PRIOR CONVICTION, SHALL BE PUNISHABLE
   22  BY A FINE OF SIX HUNDRED TEN DOLLARS AND SHALL NOT EXCEED  ONE  THOUSAND
   23  TWO  HUNDRED  TEN  DOLLARS.    IN ADDITION TO ANY PENALTIES WHICH MAY BE

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1  IMPOSED PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION, THE VIOLATOR'S LICENSE AND  REGIS-
    2  TRATION SHALL BE REVOKED AUTOMATICALLY FOR A PERIOD OF FIVE YEARS.
    3    S  2.  Subparagraphs  (x)  and (xi) of paragraph a of subdivision 2 of
    4  section 510 of the vehicle and traffic law, as added by chapter  571  of
    5  the laws of 2006, are amended and two new subparagraphs (xii) and (xiii)
    6  are added to read as follows:
    7    (x)  of  a  traffic  infraction  for a subsequent violation of article
    8  twenty-six of this chapter and the commission of such  violation  caused
    9  serious  physical injury to another person and such subsequent violation
   10  occurred within eighteen months of a prior violation of any provision of
   11  article twenty-six of this chapter where the commission  of  such  prior
   12  violation caused the serious physical injury or death of another person;
   13  [or]
   14    (xi)  of  a  traffic  infraction for a subsequent violation of article
   15  twenty-six of this chapter and the commission of such  violation  caused
   16  the death of another person and such subsequent violation occurred with-
   17  in  eighteen  months  of  a  prior violation of any provision of article
   18  twenty-six of this chapter where the commission of such prior  violation
   19  caused the serious physical injury or death of another person;
   20    (XII)  OF  A  SECOND  VIOLATION  OF  SUBDIVISION (B) OF SECTION TWELVE
   21  HUNDRED FIFTY-FOUR OF THIS CHAPTER SHALL RESULT IN A LICENSE AND  REGIS-
   22  TRATION REVOCATION OF ONE YEAR; OR
   23    (XIII)  OF  A  THIRD  VIOLATION  OF  SUBDIVISION (B) OF SECTION TWELVE
   24  HUNDRED FIFTY-FOUR OF THIS CHAPTER SHALL RESULT IN A LICENSE AND  REGIS-
   25  TRATION REVOCATION OF FIVE YEARS.
   26    S 3. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   27  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to performance of illegal maneuvers while operating a motorcycle
